thread.title: Pattonville student dies of injuries from motorcycle wreck
thread.title_full: Pattonville student dies of injuries from motorcycle wreck

author: From Staff Reports
title: Pattonville student dies of injuries from motorcycle wreck
text:
Pattonville student dies of injuries from motorcycle wreck From Staff Reports 2 hrs ago ( … ) 
MARYLAND HEIGHTS • Cory Fisk, a junior at Pattonville High School, has died of injuries he suffered in a motorcycle accident on Feb. 5, the school announced. 
Fisk, 17, died Monday in a hospital. He was a passenger on a Kawasaki motorcycle that collided with a Toyota Corolla at Natural Bridge Road and Fairfield Avenue. The intersection is east of St. Louis-Lambert International Airport. 
Fisk was from Maryland Heights, the Missouri Highway Patrol said. The patrol said the motorcycle was eastbound and collided with the car, which was pulling out of Fairfield. 
Mickey Schoonover, a spokeswoman for Pattonville High, said school officials announced Fisk's death Tuesday and offered counseling services to fellow students. 
Fisk was a passenger on the Kawasaki driven by Matthew Cody, 20, also of Maryland Heights. He also was seriously injured and was listed in fair condition Tuesday at Barnes-Jewish Hospital. Tags
